Posted By: Duelwolf (8/21/2009 9:15:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: So out of the five new Lords in 2010 base set this is unforunately only a marginal card. Now before you goblin lovers got about flinging yourselves at me lets look at the other Lords for 2010. Now it high time that another Goblin beside Goblin King gives +1/+1 because Soldiers, Elves, and even Merfolk have more than 2 cards that give +1/+1 to their brothers. Giving haste is ok. A number of goblins, at least the best one in my mind, already have haste as an ability and the worst of the Warchiefs, Goblin Warchief gives haste to Goblins too. In my mind this should have been Goblin Warchief during the Onslaught block. But hey look on the bright side at least this isnt as worthless as Merfolk Sovereign.

Posted By: PaladinOfSunhome (9/22/2009 10:24:01 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ZioKai  
I would argue that [Goblin Chieftain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftain) and [Elvish Archdruid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Archdruid) are the two most powerful lords in the set. Let's take a look:  
[Captain of the Watch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captain of the Watch)  
Great ability, great tokens, popular tribe....and there's its mana cost. With [Brighthearth Banneret](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brighthearth Banneret) rotating, as well as [Preeminent Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Preeminent Captain), there aren't any ways to "cheat" this card into play. And let's face it, what good is an aggressive card unless it's costed for, at the latest, the midgame. And, this "Lord" can't even be hit by a [Reveillark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reveillark). So, on the whole, not that great.  
[Merfolk Sovereign](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk Sovereign)  
With the rotation of [Wake Thrasher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wake Thrasher), this card won't see play unless there's some big, nasty beater that lacks evasion that's also a merfolk.  
[Cemetary Reaper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cemetary Reaper)  
Definitely worse than [Lord of the Undead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Undead). Won't, or at least shouldn't, see play.  
... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

With the rotation of Wake Thrasher, this card won't see play unless there's some big, nasty beater that lacks evasion that's also a merfolk.
